subject: Programming
title: Jimmy Wales and Wikipedia
description: Learn Jimmy Wales and Wikipedia in one minute.

hook.text: One person decided to build a free encyclopedia that anyone could edit. Experts laughed.

buildup.text: Jimmy Wales launched Wikipedia in 2001, trusting crowds to write and police knowledge collectively.

discovery.text: Wikipedia grew to millions of articles in hundreds of languages, dwarfing every traditional encyclopedia.

twist.text: Vandalism and bias are real problems. But the community catches most errors faster than paid editors.

climax.text: Wikipedia proved that open collaboration could produce something rival institutions couldn't match.

punchline.text: An encyclopedia anyone can edit actually works.

quiz.question: What principle does Wikipedia rely on?
